summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) and FBI agents regarding discovery issues in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The AUSA requests clarification on various digital and physical evidence, including grand jury testimony audio files, scanned documents, and the status of evidence processing from the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The primary correspondent requesting discovery materials, including grand jury transcripts, evidence scans, and FBI files related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: FBI agent corresponding with the AUSA, providing updates on evidence processing, including media items from Reiter and the status of disk reviews.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: Law enforcement officer involved in the discovery process, apologizing for delays due to field surveillance and scheduling a call to discuss discovery questions.

persons.name: Tony Figuero
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the detective has a scheduled call with, indicating potential involvement or relevance to the investigation.

persons.name: Reiter
persons.context: Individual or entity that provided evidence to the FBI, including boxes of media (VHS, cassette, microcassettes) and newspaper articles.

events.title: Evidence Transfer Update

events.title: Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: Reference to audio files from Grand Jury Testimony on July 19, 2006, which the AUSA cannot play and is seeking clarification on.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
VI (likely U.S. Virgin Islands, referenced for searches)
keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing discovery efforts in the Ghislaine Maxwell case as of September 2020, with prosecutors seeking extensive evidence from the Epstein investigation.
Evidence includes grand jury testimony from July 2006, but audio files are not playing, indicating potential technical or access issues.
Reiter is a significant source of evidence, providing boxes of media (VHS, cassette, microcassettes) and newspaper articles to the FBI.
The FBI is processing a large volume of digital evidence, including removing nude/semi-nude images before production to the defense.
Prosecutors are requesting the full FBI Sentinel file, CART paperwork for data extractions, and all 302s related to device extractions and image reviews.
